intro: Euphorbiodendron dussii, commonly known as the Dussis euphorbia, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub with thick, fleshy stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are inconspicuous and are often surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia. Euphorbiodendron dussii is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its stems to survive in dry conditions.
